title: CSM34X5L-A Conveyor Smart Motor
description:
With a space saving design, the CSM34 is a fully integrated, all in one drive and motor that eliminates the need for separate cabinets, gearheads, and extra wiring which reduces the overall footprint of the conveyor system.

The direct panel control and status display on the motor makes it easy for control and monitoring and for operators to configure the system without the need for external computers or communication wiring.

Also, with high torque at low speeds and a service life of over 20,000 hours, the CSM34 motor is built to outlast traditional AC induction or brushless motors and gearheads.


StepSERVO Closed-Loop Stepper Technology


StepSERVO technology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly configurable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVO integrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.


IO Control


Each CSM34 integrated motor comes with 4 digital inputs and 2 digital outputs. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for direct motor control, motor rotation direction, clear alarm, motor disable and secondary speed. The digital outputs can be used for alarm output and dynamics in position signal.


7 Segment Status Display with Control Switch


CSM has built in 7 segment display for motor status, operator can monitor motor speed, alarm status from the display. The 4 push button for motor operation control allows the operator to directly configure the motor speed, acceleration, and perform testing moves.


Optional Remote Control Panel


The CSM34 motor has an optional remote control. It can be connected to the communication port on the back of the motors. Remote offers the same control and display functionality as the built-in panel and button with no additional power supplier required.


UL Recognized


This StepSERVO Integrated Motor is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E515393.

To learn more on how our CSM34s meet UL requirements, read our CSM34 Product Change Notification.
features: Integrated Motor and Drive | StepSERVO close loop position/speed control | Gearless motion solution | Up to 6Nm torque output | Direct plug-in connection for quick installation | On the fly speed change | 2 configurable speed settings on motor | 5 digit, 7 segment motor status display | Push button configuration and jog motion | Optional CSM34 Remote Control for easy access (sold separately)

title: MBDV-520AC-H01 DC Powered Single Axis Servo Drive w/ CANopen and Modbus
description:
Drive Features

 

The MBDV servo drive is a DC powered drive for controlling 8-pole servo motors. It offers many features designed with the AGV industry in mind. These include built-in electromagnetic brake control, dynamic braking capability, regenerative braking configuration, E-Stop presets, encoder output to primary controllers, and safety controllers. With added safety in mind, these multi-axis drives have been tested and comply with STO (SIL2) standards. To meet the high-power demands of many AGV applications, the drive can output 20 A of continuous current and 60 A peak current – all packaged within a compact footprint.

 

Packaged along with our latest software, Luna, this drive solution can be a powerful tool to leverage during the development stages. The software permits users to use auto-tuning functions that arrive to highly accurate PID loop values. Users also gain access to several tools for monitoring such as scope that allows for four channel monitoring, parameter tables for easy editing, and many more.

 

Drive Variations

 

The MBDV comes in two variations, single and dual axis. The above features are included in both. The dual axis drive offers individual configuration and control of each axis. This allows a unique NODEID or RS-485 address to be assigned to each axis. Different operation settings may also be selected for each drive and the IO connector shared between both axes includes IO for each axis.

 

Communications

 

Drive Part No.

Communications

Description

 

 

 

 

MBDV

 

 

CANopen

·        Conforms to CiA402 and CiA301 specifications.

·        Supports Profile Positioning, Profile Velocity, Profile Torque, and Homing Modes for CANopen.

·        Supports daisy chain communications over CANopen.

 

RS-485 (Modbus RTU)

·        Supports Applied Motion’s SCL over RS-485.

·        Supports Modbus RTU over RS-485.

·        Supports daisy chain communications over RS-485.

  • DC Power Supply (required)

  • Regen clamp (optional)
  • USB to USB Mini cable (optional, required for AMP software utilization)
  • Encoder Output cable (optional)


UL Recognized

This drive is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E332730.

title: TSM11Q-3RM-H01 NEMA 11 StepSERVO Integrated Motor w/ Daisy-chain connectors, Q Prog. & Modbus RTU
description:
The TSM11Q-3RM-H01 StepSERVO integrated motor is a variation of the standard TSM11Q-3RM. This "H01" version includes a pre-assembled connector module that separates the single connector of the standard motor into three separate connectors - one connector for power and I/O, one for RS-485 in, and one for RS-485 out - which facilitates easier connections for daisy-chained RS-485 and Modbus RTU networks.

For more information on the functionality and capabilities of this integrated motor see the standard TSM11Q-3RM page.

Optional Planetary Gearheads

This integrated motor is available with a factory-installed planetary gearhead for applications requiring additional torque. PH gearheads feature an all-steel gear train, stainless steel housing, and aluminum front and rear flanges for maximum durability. Multiple ratios are available. Click here to view part numbers and options: products/ph-mini-planetary-gearheads.

NOT included:

  • DC power supply (required), see Power Supplies below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: StepSERVO™ technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 11 frame size | Enhanced (separate) connectors for power & I/O and comms | Q programming control mode for stand-alone operation | Modbus RTU for easy PLC and HMI communication | SERVO "Boost" torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | Dual RS-485 ports for programming, communications, and daisy-chain network connections | Built-in 4,096 count/rev encoder for closed-loop control

title: TSM17P-3AG NEMA 17 Integrated StepSERVO Motor w/ Pulse & Direction Control
description:
The TSM17P-3AG integrated StepSERVO is a drive+motor unit, fusing a NEMA 17 step motor and a servo drive into a single device. Power to the drive, located at the rear of the motor, must be supplied by an external DC supply. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible 24 and 48 volt DC power supplies.

StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly customizable motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost torque of 25-50% higher than rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVOintegrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.

The TSM17P-3AG integrated StepSERVOcomes with 4 digital inputs and 3 digital outputs and is designed for step & direction control from an external controller. The external controller can be a motion controller, PLC, or other device that provides two digital outputs: one output for digital pulses to control position and velocity of the motor, and a second output to control the direction of the motor, CW and CCW. An additional control mode, known as Encoder Following or A/B Quadrature, can also be used to control this motor. The third and fourth digital inputs may be used for servo enable and alarm reset functions respectively. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and are used for connecting pulse & direction signals or quadrature encoder signals, as well as PLC outputs, sensors, or relays. The digital outputs can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays, or other devices.

The TSM17P-3AG comes with an RS-232 port for configuration and servo loop tuning with Applied Motion's Step-Servo Quick Tuner software. An integral 5000-line (20,000 count/rev) incremental encoder is housed inside the same enclosure as the drive electronics and used for closed-loop servo control to attain highly accurate position and velocity control. These differential encoder signals (A,B,Z channels) can be accessed directly from the I/O connector pins for use with a 3rd party multi-axis controller.



NOT included:
  • DC power supply (required), see Power Supplies below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: StepSERVO™ technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 17 frame size | Step & Direction, A/B Quadrature and CW/CCW control modes | SERVO "Boost" torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | RS-232 port for configuration and servo tuning | Built-in 20,000 count/rev encoder for closed-loop control

title: TSM17Q-3RG NEMA 17 Integrated StepSERVO Motor w/ Q Programming & Modbus/RTU
description:
The TSM17Q-3RG integrated StepSERVO is a drive+motor unit, fusing a NEMA 17 step motor and a servo drive into a single device. Power to the drive, located at the rear of the motor, must be supplied by an external DC supply. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible 24 and 48 volt DC power supplies.

StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly customizable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost torque of 25-50% higher than rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVOintegrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.

The TSM17Q-3RG integrated StepSERVOcan be operated in several different control modes, including Streaming Command mode using either SCL or Modbus/RTU, Pulse & Direction mode, and Velocity mode, plus it has the ability to run a Q program stored in non-volatile memory. Q programs are created using Applied Motion's Q Programmer software, which provides powerful commands for motion, I/O, conditional processing, multi-tasking, math functions, and more. All TSM17 units are setup, configured and tuned using Applied Motion's Step-Servo Quick Tuner software with built in Q Programmer

Each TSM17 integrated stepper comes with 8 digital inputs, 4 digital output, and 1 analog input. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for connecting pulse & direction signals, end-of-travel limit switches, jog switches, quadrature encoder signals, PLC outputs, sensors, or many other signal types. The digital outputs can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays, or other devices. The analog input accepts 0-5 VDC signals and can be used for velocity and position control.

The TSM17Q-3RG comes with an RS-485 port for programming and serial communications to allow for the use either Modbus/RTU or Applied Motion's Streaming Command Language (SCL). An integral 5000-line (20,000 count/rev) incremental encoder is housed inside the same enclosure as the drive electronics and used for closed-loop servo control to attain highly accurate position and velocity control. Encoder counts can be accessed over the network or from within the Q program using SCL registers.



NOT included:
  • DC power supply (required), see Power Supplies below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: StepSERVO™ technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 17 frame size | Q programming control mode for stand-alone operation | Modbus/RTU for easy PLC and HMI communication | SERVO "Boost" torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | RS-485 port for programming and communications | Built-in 20,000 count/rev encoder for closed-loop control

title: TSM23X3B-R NEMA 23 StepSERVO Integrated Motor with TruCount Encoder , RS-485
description:
The TSM23x3B StepSERVO Integrated Motor is a drive+encoder+motor unit, fusing a NEMA 23 step motor and a servo drive into a single device. Power to the drive, located at the rear of the motor, must be supplied by an external DC supply. See Recommended Products below for compatible 48 volt DC power supplies.

StepSERVO Closed-Loop Stepper Technology

StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly configurable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVOintegrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.

TruCount Multi-Turn Absolute Encoder Technology


TruCount absolute encoders provide the ultimate in hassle-free positioning of rotary and linear axes. TruCountencoders are multi-turn, absolute encoders that don't require batteries or external power to track encoder position while the motor is powered off. There are no mechanical gears in TruCountencoders. The encoders make use of a novel energy harvesting technique that continues to track motor position when the motor is powered off. Any amount of displacement in the shaft causes enough energy to be created for the motor to continue tracking its absolute position. It is an extremely effective approach to multi-turn, absolute position tracking. Utilizing multi-turn, absolute encoders in motion control applications reduces downtime by shortening machine power up sequences and eliminates the need for homing runs after power cycles and emergency stops (e-stops).


Models Available

Part No. Communications Description

TSM23x3B-IP Ethernet
  • Dual Ethernet ports for configuration, programming, and networking connections.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to multiple axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL).
  • Built-in support for EtherNet/IP and Modbus TCP industrial networking protocols.
TSM23x3B-R RS-485
  • Dual RS-485 ports for configuration, programming, and networking connections.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to as many as 32 axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL).
  • Built-in support for Modbus RTU industrial networking protocol.

title: TSM34IP-3DG NEMA 34 StepSERVO Integrated Motor w/ EtherNet/IP
description:
The TSM34IP-3DG StepSERVOintegrated motor is a drive+motor unit, fusing a NEMA 34 step motor and a servo drive into a single device. Power to the drive, located at the rear of the motor, must be supplied by an external DC supply. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible 24 and 48 volt DC power supplies.

StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly customizable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVOintegrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.

The TSM34IP-3DG integrated StepSERVOincorporates EtherNet/IP network communications, the widely used industrial protocol for manufacturing automation applications. Implicit (Class 1) and explicit (Class 3) messaging are supported. With EtherNet/IP users can control, configure and query the drive using an open, standards-based, industrial Ethernet connection at speeds up to 100 MBits/sec. All drive+motor features can be accessed over EtherNet/IP, including more than 100 commands and 130 registers for controlling motion, I/O, configuration, polling, math, register manipulation, and Q programming. This integrated StepSERVOcan be operated in several different control modes, including Streaming Command mode using either SCL, Pulse & Direction mode, and Velocity mode, plus it has the ability to run a Q program stored in non-volatile memory. Q programs are created using Applied Motion's Q Programmer software, which provides powerful commands for motion, I/O, conditional processing, multi-tasking, math functions, and more. All TSM34 units are setup, configured and tuned using Applied Motion's Step-Servo Quick Tuner software with built in Q Programmer

Each TSM34 integrated motor comes with 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs, and 1 analog input. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for connecting pulse & direction signals, end-of-travel limit switches, jog switches, quadrature encoder signals, PLC outputs, sensors, or many other signal types. The digital output can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays, or other devices. The analog input accepts 0-5 VDC signals and can be used for velocity and position control.

The TSM34IP-3DG comes with a fast 10/100 MBit Ethernet port for programming and EtherNet/IP communications. The same port also supports TCP and UDP protocols for sending commands from Applied Motion's proprietary serial command language (SCL). As well as the popular Modbus/TCP protocol.



NOT included:
  • DC power supply (required), see Power Supplies below
  • Regen clamp (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below



UL Recognized
  • This integrated StepSERVO motor is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E515393.
features: StepSERVO technology featuring space vector current control | Peak torques for greater acceleration and throughput | Higher efficiency, lower power consumption than open loop steppers | Hi-resolution 20,000 count encoder for closed-loop control | NEMA 34 frame size | Q programming control mode for stand-alone operation | Dual-port Ethernet with RJ45 connectors | UDP, TCP/IP, and Modbus TCP for easy PLC and HMI communication | EtherNet/IP support for easy PLC and HMI communication

title: TXM34IP-3DG IP65 Rated NEMA 34 StepSERVO Integrated Motor w/ EtherNet/IP
description:
The TXM34IP-3DG StepSERVOintegrated motor is a drive+motor unit, fusing a NEMA 34 step motor and a servo drive into a single device. Power to the drive, located at the rear of the motor, must be supplied by an external DC supply. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible 24 and 48 volt DC power supplies.

StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly customizable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVOintegrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.

The TXM34IP-3DG StepSERVOntegrated StepSERVOincorporates EtherNet/IP network communications, the widely used industrial protocol for manufacturing automation applications. Implicit (Class 1) and explicit (Class 3) messaging are supported.. With EtherNet/IP users can control, configure and query the drive using an open, standards-based, industrial Ethernet connection at speeds up to 100 MBits/sec. All drive+motor features can be accessed over EtherNet/IP, including more than 100 commands and 130 registers for controlling motion, I/O, configuration, polling, math, register manipulation, and Q programming. This integrated StepSERVOcan be operated in several different control modes, including Streaming Command mode using either SCL, Pulse & Direction mode, and Velocity mode, plus it has the ability to run a Q program stored in non-volatile memory. Q programs are created using Applied Motion's Q Programmer software, which provides powerful commands for motion, I/O, conditional processing, multi-tasking, math functions, and more. All TXM34 units are setup, configured and tuned using Applied Motion's Step-Servo Quick Tuner software with built in Q Programmer

Each TXM34 integrated motor comes with 5 digital inputs, 3 digital outputs, and 1 analog input. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for connecting pulse & direction signals, end-of-travel limit switches, jog switches, quadrature encoder signals, PLC outputs, sensors, or many other signal types. The digital outputs can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays, or other devices. The analog input accepts 0-5 VDC signals and can be used for velocity and position control.

The TXM34IP-3DG comes with a fast 10/100 MBit Ethernet port for programming and EtherNet/IP communications. The same port also supports TCP and UDP protocols for sending commands from Applied Motion's proprietary serial command language (SCL). As well as the popular Modbus/TCP protocol.

All TXM34 models are RoHS compliant and meet IP65 standards to ensure reliable operation in wet and dusty installation environments.



NOT included:
  • DC power supply (required), see Power Supplies below
  • Mating cables (required), see Accessories below
  • Regen clamp (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below



UL Recognized
  • This integrated StepSERVO motor is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E515393.
features: StepSERVO technology featuring space vector current control | Peak torques for greater acceleration and throughput | Higher efficiency, lower power consumption than open loop steppers | Hi-resolution 20,000 count encoder for closed-loop control | Rated IP65 for wet and dusty environments | M12 connectors | NEMA 34 frame size | Q programming control mode for stand-alone operation | Dual-port Ethernet with M12 connectors | UDP, TCP/IP, and Modbus TCP for easy PLC and HMI communication | EtherNet/IP support for easy PLC and HMI communication

title: TXM34Q-3RG IP65 Rated NEMA 34 StepSERVO Integrated Motor w/ Q Programming and Modbus RTU
description:
The TXM34Q-3RG StepSERVOintegrated motor is a drive+motor unit, fusing a NEMA 34 step motor and a servo drive into a single device. Power to the drive, located at the rear of the motor, must be supplied by an external DC supply. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible 24 and 48 volt DC power supplies.

StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly customizable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVOintegrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.

The TXM34Q-3RG StepSERVOintegrated motor can be operated in several different control modes, including streaming command mode using SCL commands or Modbus RTU, pulse & direction mode, velocity mode, and stored program mode which offers the ability to run a Q program stored in non-volatile memory. Q programs are created using Applied Motion's Q Programmer software, which provides powerful commands for motion, I/O, conditional processing, multi-tasking, math functions, and more. All TXM34 integrated motors are set up, configured and tuned using Applied Motion's Step-Servo Quick Tuner software with built in Q Programmer

Each TXM34 integrated motor comes with 5 digital inputs, 3 digital outputs, and 1 analog input. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for connecting pulse & direction signals, end-of-travel limit switches, jog switches, quadrature encoder signals, PLC outputs, sensors, or many other signal types. The digital outputs can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays, or other devices. The analog input accepts 0-5 VDC signals and can be used for velocity and position control.

The TXM34Q-3RG comes with an RS-485 port for programming and serial communications to allow for the use of either Modbus RTU or Applied Motion's Streaming Command Language (SCL). An integral 5000-line (20,000 count/rev) incremental encoder is housed inside the same enclosure as the drive electronics and used for closed-loop servo control to attain highly accurate position and velocity control. Encoder counts can be accessed over the network or from within the Q program using data registers.

All TXM34 models are RoHS compliant and meet IP65 standards to ensure reliable operation in wet and dusty installation environments.



NOT included:
  • DC power supply (required), see Power Supplies below
  • Mating cables (required), see Accessories below
  • Regen clamp (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below



UL Recognized
  • This integrated StepSERVO motor is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E515393.

title: 1000-382 PoE+ Injector for Power over Ethernet products
description:
The 1000-382 is a midspan injector designed to supply power over Ethernet to compatible integrated motors. The injector includes two RJ45 ports and an IEC standard AC power connector. Mating AC power cable is included.

Compatible Integrated Motors
  • TSM14POE3M-IPEJ StepSERVOintegrated motor with RJ45 Ethernet connector
  • TSM14POE3M-JGxx StepSERVOintegrated motor with RJ45 Ethernet connector and planetary gearhead
  • TSM14POE3M-IPEM StepSERVOintegrated motor with M12 Ethernet connector
  • TSM14POE3M-MGxx StepSERVOintegrated motor with M12 Ethernet connector and planetary gearhead



Agency Approvals
  • CE & FCC approved, RoHS compliant, EN 60950:2006 safety.

title: 3004-257 WAA, YAA, ZAA Encoder Extension Cable with flying leads
description:
The 3004-257 encoder extension cable connects a step motor-mounted encoder, such as a WAA, YAA, or ZAA encoder, to any compatible device that accepts single-ended or differential encoder signals. One cable is required for each encoder installation.

The 3004-257 cable can be used with the encoder option board that can be ordered with the 3540i.

title: 3004-263 Encoder Extension Cable, 3 ft
description:
The 3004-263 encoder extension cable is designed for use with STM17R and STM23R integrated steppers with incremental encoders mounted to the rear shafts. This includes the following integrated stepper part numbers:

  • STM17R-3NE
  • STM23R-2NE
  • STM23R-3NE
An incremental encoder is externally mounted to the rear shaft of an STM17R or STM23R integrated stepper and the 3004-263 cable is used to connect this encoder to the user's step & direction controller. The 3004-263 cable provides a mating connection for the encoder at one end and flying leads at the other end.
features: Compatible with the STM17R and STM23R integrated steppers with encoder options | Connects to incremental encoder on one end | Flying leads on other end for connecting to external controller

The 3004-294 is used for setup and programming of the integrated motor and can also be used in streaming serial command (SCL) applications as a permanent connection between the TSM motor and the host device's RS-232 port. To use with a computer that does not have a 9-pin COM port, the USB-to-Serial adaptor is recommended: 3004-235.

One end of this cable plugs directly into the I/O connector on the integrated StepSERVO motor and the other end sports a DB25 male connector intended for use with the BOB-2 screw terminal breakout board. title: 3004-389 M12 Plug and Cap Kit
description:
The 3004-389 plug and cap kit is the ideal solution for unused M12 connectors on IP65 rated integrated motors, such as MDX Integrated Servo Motors, SWM Integrated Steppers, and TXM StepSERVOIntegrated Motors. The plugs and cap are IP67 rated. Using them to cover unused connectors maintains the IP65 rating of the integrated motor.

The 3004-389 kit includes the following:
  • 3 plugs for female M12 connectors
  • 1 cap for male M12 connectors

title: CPDB-A-C CSM34 Remote Control Module
description:
CPDB-A-C is a Remote Control Module for CSM series motors that can be connected to the communication port on the back of the motors. Remote offers the same control and display functionality as the built in panel and buttons.


* With CSM powered off, use 2156-XXXX cable to connect the remote control panel to the CSM serial port. (Additional power supply NOT required.)
features: Direct plug-in connection | On the fly speed change | Speed settings remotely | 5 digit, 7 segment motor status display | Push button configuration and jog motion | Quick panel mount installation | 2156-XXXX cable sold separately (required to connect to CSM34)

title: CSM34X3L-A Conveyor Smart Motor
description:
With a space saving design, the CSM34 is a fully integrated, all in one drive and motor that eliminates the need for separate cabinets, gearheads, and extra wiring which reduces the overall footprint of the conveyor system.

The direct panel control and status display on the motor makes it easy for control and monitoring and for operators to configure the system without the need for external computers or communication wiring.

Also, with high torque at low speeds and a service life of over 20,000 hours, the CSM34 motor is built to outlast traditional AC induction or brushless motors and gearheads.


StepSERVO Closed-Loop Stepper Technology


StepSERVO technology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly configurable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVO integrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.


IO Control


Each CSM34 integrated motor comes with 4 digital inputs and 2 digital outputs. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for direct motor control, motor rotation direction, clear alarm, motor disable and secondary speed. The digital outputs can be used for alarm output and dynamics in position signal.


7 Segment Status Display with Control Switch


CSM has built in 7 segment display for motor status, operator can monitor motor speed, alarm status from the display. The 4 push button for motor operation control allows the operator to directly configure the motor speed, acceleration, and perform testing moves.


Optional Remote Control Panel


The CSM34 motor has an optional remote control panel. It can be connected to the communication port on the back of the motors. The remote offers the same control and display functionality as the built-in panel and button with no additional power supplier required.


UL Recognized


This StepSERVO Integrated Motor is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E515393.

To learn more on how our CSM34s meet UL requirements, read our CSM34 Product Change Notification.
features: Integrated Motor and Drive | StepSERVO close loop position/speed control | Gearless motion solution | Up to 6Nm torque output | Direct plug-in connection for quick installation | On the fly speed change | 2 configurable speed settings on motor | 5 digit, 7 segment motor status display | Push button configuration and jog motion | Optional CSM34 Remote Control for easy access (sold separately)

title: HT11-SS1DMA NEMA 11 StepSERVO Motor
description:
StepSERVOMotors combine with StepSERVODrives to create closed loop motor and drives systems. The HT11-SS1DM is a high torque step motor with integral 1024-line (4096 count/rev) incremental encoder. The high resolution encoder is used for closed loop servo control to attain highly accurate position and velocity control.

The HT11-SS1DM is specifically designed for use with the following StepSERVODrives:
  • SSDC03 StepSERVODrive with multiple control options including EtherCAT, EtherNet/IP, Modbus TCP, CANopen and RS-485
  • SS03-EC-D StepSERVODrive with EtherCAT



StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times and greater throughput. StepSERVOsystems can be applied in applications where traditional step motors cannot achieve the high levels of accuracy and performance required.

NOT included:

  • Compatible drive (required), see StepSERVODrives below
  • Motor extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Encoder extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Planetary gearhead (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: For use with StepSERVO Drives to create closed loop motor and drive systems | StepSERVO technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 11 frame size | Boost (peak) torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | Built-in 1024-line (4096 count/rev) magnetic encoder enables high performance, closed-loop control

title: HT17-SS1DGB NEMA 17 StepSERVO Motor
description:
StepSERVOMotors combine with StepSERVODrives to create closed loop motor and drives systems. The HT17-SS1DG is a high torque step motor with integral 5000-line (20,000 count/rev) incremental encoder. The high resolution encoder is used for closed loop servo control to attain highly accurate position and velocity control

The HT17-SS1DG is specifically designed for use with the following StepSERVODrives:
  • SSDC10 StepSERVODrive with multiple control options including EtherCAT, EtherNet/IP, Modbus TCP, CANopen and RS-485
  • SS05-EC-D StepSERVODrive with EtherCAT



StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times and greater throughput. StepSERVOsystems can be applied in applications where traditional step motors cannot achieve the high levels of accuracy and performance required.

NOT included:

  • Compatible drive (required), see StepSERVODrives below
  • Motor extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Encoder extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Planetary gearhead (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: For use with StepSERVO Drives to create closed loop motor and drive systems | StepSERVO technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 17 frame size | Boost (peak) torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | Built-in 5000-line (20000 count/rev) magnetic encoder enables high performance, closed-loop control

title: HT23-548 NEMA 23 High Torque Stepper Motor
description:
Note: The HT23-548 step motor is not recommended for new applications. It has been superseded by the HT23-552.

The HT23-548 two-phase stepper motor is designed for use with high-voltage stepper drives like the STAC5 and STAC6 series (120 VAC input versions only) and is suitable for a wide range of motion control applications. The motor comes with an integral 10 ft shielded cable and a preassembled drive connector.

When not used with STAC5 or STAC6 drives, the preassembled drive connector can be removed to reveal 8 motor leads plus 1 ground lead. The 8 motor leads can be connected in one of three ways to the step motor drive of your choice: bipolar series (required for STAC5/STAC6 drives), bipolar parallel, or unipolar.
features: Not recommended for new applications | Use part number HT23-552 instead | 2-phase hybrid step motor | High torque design | Standard NEMA 23 dimensions | Optimized for high bus voltage

title: HT23-552 NEMA 23 High Torque Stepper Motor
description:
The HT23-552 two-phase stepper motor is designed for use with the STAC5 and STAC6 series of stepper drives and is suitable for a wide range of motion control applications. The motor is optimized for use with high bus-voltage drives and comes with an integral 10 ft shielded cable.

The HT23-552 step motor supersedes the HT23-548 step motor in 120 VAC applications with STAC5 and STAC6 stepper drives.

Series or Parallel Connection

The motor is terminated with 8 motor leads plus 1 ground lead making it easy to connect the motor to the drive depending on the drive voltage being used. For 120 VAC applications the motor leads must be connected in parallel. For 220 VAC applications the motor leads must be connected in series.

Available Part Numbers

Part No. Details
HT23-552Base, single shaft motor.
HT23-552DDouble shaft motor.
HT23-552D-ZAA Motor with ZAA type optical encoder mounted to rear shaft and end bell of motor. Recommended for use with Applied Motion stepper drives to perform Stall Detection and Stall Prevention functions. 2,000 CPR (8,000 counts quadrature); A, B, and Z (index) channels; differential, line driver outputs.

  • Mating cable for use with Applied Motion drives (D-sub connector): 3004-195-10
  • Mating cable with flying leads: 3004-257
HT23-552D-ZACMotor with ZAA type optical encoder (see above) mounted to rear shaft and end bell of motor.
A metal cover with integral shielded cable is mounted over the encoder to protect the encoder from dust and debris.
features: 2-phase hybrid step motor | High torque design | Standard NEMA 23 dimensions | Optimized for high bus voltage

title: HT23-554 NEMA 23 High Torque Stepper Motor
description:
The HT23-554 two-phase stepper motor is designed for use with the STAC5 and STAC6 series of stepper drives and is suitable for a wide range of motion control applications. The motor is optimized for use with high bus-voltage drives and comes with an integral 10 ft shielded cable.

The HT23-554 step motor supersedes the HT23-550 step motor in 120 VAC applications with the STAC5 and STAC6 stepper drives.

Series or Parallel Connection

The motor is terminated with 8 motor leads plus 1 ground lead making it easy to connect the motor to the drive depending on the drive voltage being used. For 120 VAC applications the motor leads must be connected in parallel. For 220 VAC applications the motor leads must be connected in series.

title: HT23-SS2DGB NEMA 23 StepSERVO Motor
description:
StepSERVOMotors combine with StepSERVODrives to create closed loop motor and drives systems. The HT23-SS2DG is a high torque step motor with integral 5000-line (20,000 count/rev) incremental encoder. The high resolution encoder is used for closed loop servo control to attain highly accurate position and velocity control

The HT23-SS2DG is specifically designed for use with the following StepSERVODrives:
  • SSDC10 StepSERVODrive with multiple control options including EtherCAT, EtherNet/IP, Modbus TCP, CANopen and RS-485
  • SS05-EC-D StepSERVODrive with EtherCAT



StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times and greater throughput. StepSERVOsystems can be applied in applications where traditional step motors cannot achieve the high levels of accuracy and performance required.

NOT included:

  • Compatible drive (required), see StepSERVODrives below
  • Motor extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Encoder extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Planetary gearhead (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: For use with StepSERVO Drives to create closed loop motor and drive systems | StepSERVO technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 23 frame size | Boost (peak) torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | Built-in 5000-line (20000 count/rev) magnetic encoder enables high performance, closed-loop control

title: HT34-695 NEMA 34 High Torque Stepper Motor
description:
The HT34-695 two-phase stepper motor is suitable for a wide range of motion control applications. The motor is optimized for use with high bus-voltage stepper drives such as the STAC5, STAC6 and STRAC series drives. The motor comes with an integral 10 ft shielded cable and is terminated with 8 motor leads plus 1 ground lead making it easy to connect the motor to the drive depending on the supply voltage being used. For 120 VAC applications the motor leads must be connected in parallel. For 220 VAC applications the motor leads must be connected in series.

UL Recognized

The single and double shaft versions of this motor are UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E472271. The encoder and encoder cover are not included in the listing.
features: 2-phase hybrid step motor | High torque design | Standard NEMA 34 dimensions | Integral 10 ft shielded cable w/ strain relief | The motor is UL Recognized | Double-shaft version available with optional encoder | Optimized for high bus voltage operation

title: HT34-SS1DGA NEMA 34 StepSERVO Motor
description:
StepSERVOMotors combine with StepSERVODrives to create closed loop motor and drives systems. The HT34-SS1DG is a high torque step motor with integral 5000-line (20,000 count/rev) incremental encoder. The high resolution encoder is used for closed loop servo control to attain highly accurate position and velocity control

The HT34-SS1DG is specifically designed for use with the following StepSERVODrives:
  • SSDC10 StepSERVODrive with multiple control options including EtherCAT, EtherNet/IP, Modbus TCP, CANopen and RS-485
  • SS10-EC-D StepSERVODrive with EtherCAT



StepSERVOtechnology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost (or peak) torque that is higher than the rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times and greater throughput. StepSERVOsystems can be applied in applications where traditional step motors cannot achieve the high levels of accuracy and performance required.

NOT included:

  • Compatible drive (required), see StepSERVODrives below
  • Motor extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Encoder extension cable (recommended), see Accessories below
  • Planetary gearhead (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: For use with StepSERVO Drives to create closed loop motor and drive systems | StepSERVO technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 34 frame size | Boost (peak) torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | Built-in 5000-line (20000 count/rev) magnetic encoder enables high performance, closed-loop control

title: HW23-598 IP65 Rated, NEMA 23 High Torque Stepper Motor
description:
The HW23-598 two-phase stepper motor is suitable for a wide range of motion control applications including wet factory environments and outdoor use. The IP65 rating means the motor is dust proof and resistant to lower pressure water jets. Key features of this rating include an integral 10 ft shielded cable, a nickel plated brass cable gland, sealed laminations and a front shaft contact seal. This motor also has an internal corrosion-resistant film coating, further protecting it in wet and humid environments.

A double-shaft version with encoder is available, part number HW23-598D-ZAC.

IP65 specifies a product that is dust tight (no ingress of dust; complete protection against contact) and protected against water jets (water projected by a nozzle from any direction shall have no harmful effects). To see our motor design operating in a rain simulation chamber check out this video.
features: 2-phase hybrid step motor | Rated IP65 for wet and dusty environments | High torque design | Standard NEMA 23 dimensions | Integral 10 ft shielded cable w/ cable gland | Sealed laminations | Front shaft seal | Single shaft version standard | Double shaft version with encoder available

title: MBDV-2X-520AC DC Powered Dual Axis Servo Drive w/ CANopen and Modbus
description:
Drive Features

 

The MBDV servo drive is a DC powered drive for controlling 8-pole servo motors. It offers many features designed with the AGV industry in mind. These include built-in electromagnetic brake control, dynamic braking capability, regenerative braking configuration, E-Stop presets, encoder output to primary controllers, and safety controllers. With added safety in mind, these multi-axis drives have been tested and comply with STO (SIL2) standards. To meet the high-power demands of many AGV applications, the drive can output 20 A of continuous current and 60 A peak current – all packaged within a compact footprint.

 

Packaged along with our latest software, Luna, this drive solution can be a powerful tool to leverage during the development stages. Users also gain access to several tools for monitoring such as scope that allows for four channel monitoring, parameter tables for easy editing, and many more.

 

Drive Variations

 

The MBDV comes in two variations, single and dual axis. The above features are included in both. The dual axis drive offers individual configuration and control of each axis. This allows a unique NODEID or RS-485 address to be assigned to each axis. Different operation settings may also be selected for each drive and the IO connector shared between both axes includes IO for each axis.

 

Communications

  

Drive Part No.

Communications

Description

 

 

 

 

MBDV

 

 

CANopen

·        Conforms to CiA402 and CiA301 specifications.

·        Supports Profile Positioning, Profile Velocity, Profile Torque, and Homing Modes for CANopen.

·        Supports daisy chain communications over CANopen.

 

RS-485 (Modbus RTU)

·        Supports Applied Motion’s SCL over RS-485.

·        Supports Modbus RTU over RS-485.

·        Supports daisy chain communications over RS-485.


Not Included

  • Compatible Motor (required)
  • DC Power Supply (required)
  • I/O cable (optional)
  • Regen clamp (optional)
  • USB to USB Mini cable (optional, required for AMP software utilization)
  • Encoder Output cable (optional)


UL Recognized

This drive is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E332730.
features: High Current output per Axis (20 A Continuous per Axis, 60 A Peak per Axis) | Includes Electromagnetic brake control | Dynamic braking capable | Regen control and support regen resistor usage | Regenerative braking configuration  | Supports up to 750 W Servo motors | E-stop presets | Encoder output to primary controllers and safety controllers | STO (SIL2) standard compliance

title: MDXK61GN3RB000 Integrated Servo Motor, 200 W, IP20 Rated , RS-485
description:
MDX Integrated Servo Motors combine the high torque-density, low rotor-inertia design of J Series servo motors with the all-digital servo drive technology of the SV200 Servo Drives. The result is an integrated, all-in-one servo motor where feedback, servo drive and servo controller are housed in the same package as the motor. There are no cables to connect the servo drive to the motor. Power, I/O signals and communications are plugged directly into the connectors on the motor.

Inputs and Outputs

For connecting to external devices via control signals, limit switches, proximity or photoelectric sensors, PLC I/O, and more, this motor features 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs and 2 analog inputs. The function of each I/O point is configured with the MDX Servo Suite software. Details on wiring different I/O types can be found in the MDX Hardware Manual (see Downloads tab).

Note: Flying lead I/O cable is sold separately, P/N 3004-318 .

Available Part Numbers:

There are two different communication options to choose from, as shown in the table below. Every MDX Integrated Servo Motor is capable of stored program execution using Applied Motion Products' Q Programming language.

Part No.CommunicationsDescription
MDXK61GN3CB000CANopen
  • Dual CANbus ports for operation as a slave node on CANopen networks.
  • Conforms to Can in Automation (CiA) DS301 and DS402 specifications.
  • Supports Profile Position, Profile Velocity and Homing modes, as well as the ability to run stored Q programs via Applied Motion-specific CANopen objects.
MDXK61GN3RB000RS-485
  • Dual RS-485 ports for configuration, programming, and networking connections.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to as many as 32 axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL).
  • Built-in support for Modbus RTU communications.
All MDX Integrated Servo Motors are CE approved and RoHS compliant.

Not included in box

  • DC power supply (required), see accessories below
  • I/O cable (required), see accessories below
  • Regen clamp (optional), see accessories below
  • USB to serial adapter (optional), see accessories below
UL Recognized

This integrated servo motor is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E472271.
features: Servo Motor + Drive + Controller in a single integrated motor package | 24 to 60 VDC input | Wide range of control options | 8 optically isolated digital inputs | 4 digital outputs | 2 analog inputs | Encoder output A/B/Z (16384 counts/rev) | Dual-port communications on all models

title: MDXL61GN3IPB000 Integrated Servo Motor, 200 W, IP65 Rated , Ethernet w/ Ethernet/IP & Modbus
description:
MDX Integrated Servo Motors combine the high torque-density, low rotor-inertia design of J Series servo motors with the all-digital servo drive technology of the SV200 Servo Drives. The result is an integrated, all-in-one servo motor where feedback, servo drive and servo controller are housed in the same package as the motor. There are no cables to connect the servo drive to the motor. Power, I/O signals and communications are plugged directly into the connectors on the motor.

IP65 Rating and M12 Connectors

Each MDXL61GN3 integrated servo motor features an IP65 environmental rating for operation in wet and dusty environments. M12 connectors for all electrical signals ensure water and dust-tight connections for safe operation in splash zones. Gasket seals at all internal mechanical interfaces and a front shaft seal complete the protective barriers built into the motor design.

Inputs and Outputs

For connecting to external devices via control signals, limit switches, proximity or photoelectric sensors, PLC I/O, and more, this motor features 5 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs and 2 analog inputs. The function of each I/O point is configured with the MDX Servo Suite software. Details on wiring different I/O types can be found in the MDX Hardware Manual (see Downloads tab).

Available Part Numbers:

There are three different communication options to choose from, as shown in the table below. Every MDX Integrated Servo Motor is capable of stored program execution using Applied Motion Products' Q Programming language.

Part No.CommunicationsDescription
MDXL61GN3CB000CANopen
  • Dual CANbus ports for operation as a slave node on CANopen networks.
  • Conforms to Can in Automation (CiA) DS301 and DS402 specifications.
  • Supports Profile Position, Profile Velocity and Homing modes, as well as the ability to run stored Q programs via Applied Motion-specific CANopen objects.
MDXL61GN3IPB000Ethernet, Ethernet/IP
  • Dual fast 10/100 Mbit Ethernet ports for configuration, programming and networking connections.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to multiple axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL) over Ethernet. Supports both Ethernet TCP and UDP messaging.
  • Built-in support for Modbus TCP communications.
MDXL61GN3RB000RS-485
  • Dual RS-485 ports for configuration, programming, and networking connections.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to as many as 32 axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL).
  • Built-in support for Modbus RTU communications.
All MDX Integrated Servo Motors are CE approved and RoHS compliant.

Not included in box

  • DC power supply (required), see accessories below
  • Mating cables (required), see accessories below
  • Regen clamp (optional), see accessories below
  • USB to serial adapter for RS-485 and CANopen units (optional), see accessories below
UL Recognized

This integrated servo motor is UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E472271.
features: Servo Motor + Drive + Controller in a single integrated motor package | 24 to 60 VDC input | Wide range of control options | IP65 environmental protection rating | 5 optically isolated digital inputs | 4 digital outputs | 2 analog inputs | Dual-port communications on all models

title: PS480D72 70 VDC Switching Power Supply, 480W, DIN rail mount
description:
The PS480D72 switching power supply is a DIN rail mounted power supply in a fanless enclosure. It is an excellent choice for use with Applied Motion stepper drives and integrated motors.

Compatible Drives and Integrated Motors

All drives and integrated motors where the upper value of the supply voltage range is 70 volts DC or higher are compatible with this power supply, including the following:
  • StepSERVO™ Integrated Motors (e.g. TSM23P-3AG, TXM24Q-1EG)
  • StepSERVO™ Drives (e.g. SS03-EC-D)
  • Integrated Steppers (e.g. STM23Q-2AE, SWM24IP-3EE)
  • Stepper Drives (e.g. STR8, ST10-S)

Agency Approvals
The PS480D72 is UL Recognized (File No. E334573), CE approved, and RoHS compliant.
features: 480 Watts, 6.7 amps | Regulated ouptut voltage: 70 to 80 volts DC, user adjustable | Universal input voltage: 120 or 220 VAC | DIN rail mounted | Fanless enclosure | For use with DC-powered stepper drives and integrated motors

title: RC880 Regeneration Clamp for DC-Input Drives and Integrated Motors
description:
Many motor and drive systems require a clamp circuit to limit increases in bus voltage when the motor is decelerating under load. This is commonly referred to as regeneration�, and occurs when DC motors are driven by their load (backdriving). During regeneration the DC motor can produce enough voltage to actually exceed the input power supply voltage. Applied Motion drives handle regeneration by directing this increased motor voltage back to the DC connection. However, if the voltage is not clamped to a safe level then the power supply and/or drive can be damaged. This regen clamp provides over-voltage protection for regulated power supplies by continuously monitoring and comparing the power supply voltage to the voltage present at the drive's DC connection. This design handles any DC voltage level within the specified range, making the RC880 a universal shunt regulation solution.
 <br c-b2bproductdetailinfo_b2bproductdetailinfo=""><br c-b2bproductdetailinfo_b2bproductdetailinfo=""> UL Recognized in the US and Canada, file no. E515393.

title: SSDC03-IP StepSERVO Drive with multiple control options, 3 A , EtherNet/IP w/ Modbus TCP
description:
The SSDC03 StepSERVODrives are the closed-loop versions of our well established, high performance, microstepping step motor drives. By incorporating closed-loop servo control algorithms in these drives and pairing them with StepSERVOMotors with high resolution encoders, we are able to create StepSERVOsystems with performance that greatly exceeds conventional step motor performance. Peak torques as much as 50% higher; smoother, quieter operation; and lower power consumption are just some of the benefits of StepSERVODrive and Motor systems.

The SSDC03 can be powered by supply voltages in the range 12 to 48 VDC, with a recommended supply voltage of 24 VDC. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible power supplies.

StepSERVODrives are compatible only with StepSERVOMotors from Applied Motion. See Related and Recommended Products below for the motors that are compatible with this drive.

Each SSDC drive comes with 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs, and 2 analog inputs. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for connecting end-of-travel limit switches, PLC outputs, sensors and other signal types. The digital outputs can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays and other devices. The 2 analog inputs accept 0-5, 0-10, ±5 or ±10 volt signals, and can be used as an additional sensor input. Differential encoder signal outputs are also available from the drive.

There are four different communication options to choose from, as shown in the table below. All SSDC03 drives offer stored program execution using Applied Motion's Q Programming language, though only -R and -IP models can execute stored Q programs stand-alone. The -C and -EC models can only run stored Q programs as instructed by a CANopen or EtherCAT master, respectively.

Drive Part No.CommunicationsDescription
SSDC03-RRS-485
  • Dual RS-485 ports for configuration, programming, and daisy chain networking connections.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to as many as 32 axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL).
  • Built-in support for Modbus RTU communciations.
SSDC03-CCANopen
  • Dual CANbus ports for daisy chain networking and operation as a slave node on CANopen networks.
  • Conforms to Can in Automation (CiA) 301 and 402 specifications.
  • Supports Profile Position, Profile Velocity and Homing modes, as well as the ability to run stored Q programs via Applied Motion-specific CANopen objects.
SSDC03-IPEthernet, EtherNet/IP
  • Dual fast 10/100 Mbit Ethernet ports for configuration, programming and daisy chain networking connections.
  • Designed for use on EtherNet/IP networks, the widely used industrial protocol for manufacturing automation applications.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to multiple axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL) over Ethernet. Supports both TCP and UDP protocols.
  • Built-in support for Modbus TCP communications.
SSDC03-ECEtherCAT
  • Specifically designed to operate on EtherCAT networks using the CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol.
  • Conforms to CiA 402 specification.
  • Supports Cyclic Synchronous Position (CSP), Profile Position, Profile Velocity and a range of Homing modes.
  • Able to run stored Q programs, which can be controlled over the EtherCAT network via Applied Motion-specific objects.
features: For use with StepSERVO Motors to create closed loop motor and drive systems | StepSERVO technology offers superior performance from a step motor | Stored program execution for increased motion control functionality | Peak torques of 25-50% higher than holding torque | 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs, optically isolated | 2 analog inputs, software configurable | Dual-port communication for daisy chain networking

title: SSDC10-R StepSERVO Drive with multiple control options, 10 A , RS-485 w/ Modbus RTU
description:
The SSDC10 StepSERVODrives are the closed-loop versions of our well established, high performance, microstepping step motor drives. By incorporating closed-loop servo control algorithms in these drives and pairing them with StepSERVOMotors with high resolution encoders, we are able to create StepSERVOsystems with performance that greatly exceeds conventional step motor performance. Peak torques as much as 50% higher; smoother, quieter operation; and lower power consumption are just some of the benefits of StepSERVODrive and Motor systems.

The SSDC10 can be powered by supply voltages in the range 24 to 70 VDC, with a recommended supply voltage of 48 VDC. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible power supplies.

StepSERVODrives are compatible only with StepSERVOMotors from Applied Motion. See Related and Recommended Products below for the motors that are compatible with this drive.

Each SSDC drive comes with 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs, and 2 analog inputs. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for connecting end-of-travel limit switches, PLC outputs, sensors and other signal types. The digital outputs can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays and other devices. The 2 analog inputs accept 0-5, 0-10, ±5 or ±10 volt signals, and can be used as an additional sensor input. Differential encoder signal outputs are also available from the drive.

There are four different communication options to choose from, as shown in the table below. All SSDC10 drives offer stored program execution using Applied Motion's Q Programming language, though only -R and -IP models can execute stored Q programs stand-alone. The -C and -EC models can only run stored Q programs as instructed by a CANopen or EtherCAT master, respectively.

title: SSM23IP-2EG NEMA 23 Integrated StepSERVO Motor w/ EtherNet/IP
description:
The SSM23IP-2EG integrated StepSERVO is a drive+motor unit, fusing a NEMA 23 step motor and a servo drive into a single device. Power to the drive, located at the rear of the motor, must be supplied by an external DC supply. See Related and Recommended Products below for compatible 24 and 48 volt DC power supplies.


StepSERVO technology combines the high torque capabilities of a step motor with the closed loop dynamic control of a servo system. The result is a highly customizable all-in-one motion control solution that operates quietly and efficiently, requiring only the minimum amount of current to maintain commanded position and velocity. Boost torque of 25-50% higher than rated holding torque increases the limits of acceleration, leading to faster cycle times. StepSERVO integrated motors can be applied in systems where a traditional stepper motor would not be capable of achieving the high accuracy required.


The SSM23IP-2EG integrated StepSERVO incorporates EtherNet/IP network communications, the widely used industrial protocol for manufacturing automation applications. With EtherNet/IP users can control, configure and query the drive using an open, standards-based, industrial Ethernet connection at speeds up to 100 MBits/sec. All drive+motor features can be accessed over EtherNet/IP, including more than 100 commands and 130 registers for controlling motion, I/O, configuration, polling, math, register manipulation, and Q programming. This integrated StepSERVO can be operated in several different control modes, including Streaming Command mode using either SCL, Pulse & Direction mode, and Velocity mode, plus it has the ability to run a Q program stored in non-volatile memory. Q programs are created using Applied Motion's Q Programmer software, which provides powerful commands for motion, I/O, conditional processing, multi-tasking, math functions, and more. All SSM23 units are setup, configured and tuned using Applied Motion's Step-Servo Quick Tuner software with built in Q Programmer


Each SSM23IP integrated StepSERVO comes with 3 digital inputs, 1 digital output, and 1 analog input. The digital inputs accept signals of 5-24 VDC and can be used for connecting pulse & direction signals, end-of-travel limit switches, jog switches, quadrature encoder signals, PLC outputs, sensors, or many other signal types. The digital output can be connected to PLC inputs, counters, lights, relays, or other devices. The analog input accepts 0-5 VDC signals and can be used for velocity and position control.


The SSM23IP-2EG comes with a fast 10/100 MBit Ethernet port for programming and EtherNet/IP communications. The same port also supports TCP and UDP protocols for sending commands from Applied Motion's proprietary serial command language (SCL).


All SSM23IP models are CE Conformant and ODVA Conformant for EtherNet/IP.




NOT included:

  • DC power supply (required), see Power Supplies below
  • Regen clamp (optional), see Accessories below
  • Additional accessories available below
features: StepSERVO™ technology featuring space vector current control | NEMA 23 frame size | EtherNet/IP support for easy PLC and HMI communication | Q programming control mode for stand-alone operation | StepSERVO "Boost" torque of 25-50% higher than holding torque | RJ45 Ethernet port for programming and communications | Built-in 20,000 count/rev encoder for closed-loop contro

title: ST10-Q-RE DC Advanced Microstep Drive w/ Q Programming & Encoder Input
description:
The ST10-Q-RE stepper drive is a DC-powered microstepping drive for controlling two-phase, bipolar step motors. It offers advanced current control and a sophisticated 3rd generation anti-resonance algorithm that electronically dampens motor and system resonances to improve motor smoothness and usable torque over a wide speed range. The drive also employs electronic torque ripple smoothing and microstep emulation to greatly reduce motor noise and vibration. The drive must be powered from 24-80 VDC and can output up to 10.0 A/phase (peak-of-sine) to the step motor. Over-voltage, over-temperature and over-current protection features prevent damage while running in adverse conditions. The drive is complemented by a specifically matched set of NEMA 23 and NEMA 34 frame stepper motors (see Related and Recommended products below).

The ST10-Q-RE can operate in all of the same control modes as the S model (pulse & direction, velocity, streaming commands, SiNet Hub operation), plus it has the ability to run stand-alone Q programs stored in non-volatile memory. Q programs are created using the Q Programmer™ software, which provides multi-tasking, math functions, conditional processing, data register manipulation, and more features in a robust yet simple text-based programming language. The drive is setup and configured using Applied Motion's ST Configurator™ software. Preconfigured motor setup files included with ST Configurator™ make it easy to set up the drive for optimum results.

For connecting to external devices such as control signals, incremental encoders, limit switches, proximity or photoelectric sensors, PLC I/O, lamps, and other devices, the drive comes with 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs, and 2 single-ended analog inputs (analog inputs can be wired together as 1 differential analog input). Adjustable digital filters are present on the digital inputs for enhanced reliability in noisy environments.

The drive comes with an RS-232 port for configuration, serial communications and programming. It also comes with an RS-485 port for streaming serial commands over serial networks with up to 32 axes.

The ST10-Q-RE comes with an encoder feedback connector for applications that demand a higher level of position control than ordinary open-loop step motor systems can provide. Use our double-shaft step motors with incremental encoders and activate either Stall Detection or Stall Prevention in the drive. Stall Detection notifies the system as soon as the required torque is too great for the motor, which results in a loss of synchronization between the rotor and stator, also known as stalling. Stall Prevention automatically adjusts motor speed to maintain synchronization of the rotor to the stator under all conditions. This unique feature allows step motors to operate in a much broader range of applications than previously possible, such as torque-control. The Stall Prevention feature also performs static position maintenance, which maintains the position of the motor shaft when at rest. Additionally, the inclusion of the optional encoder allows the motor to be precisely homed to the index (marker) pulse.

All ST drives are CE approved and RoHS compliant.
features: Programmable microstepping drive with advanced current control | Q Programmer™ for robust motion control programming | 744 lines of stored program capability | Math calculations using analog and digital parameters | Supports all SERVO™ drive control modes as well | Modbus/RTU for easy PLC and HMI communication | Compatible with many 3rd party HMIs | Wide current range 0.1 to 10.0 A/phase (peak of sine) with idle current reduction | Advanced anti-resonance algorithm | Torque ripple smoothing | 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs, optically isolated | 2 analog inputs, +/-10 volt range | Encoder feedback connector for Stall Prevention & Stall Detection | RS-232 cable and mating connectors included | RS-485 port for serial networking up to 32 axes

title: STAC5-IP-E220 AC EtherNet/IP Advanced Microstep Drive w/ Encoder Input
description:
The STAC5-IP-E220 stepper drive employs sophisticated current control designed for optimal smoothness over a wide speed range. Anti-resonance, torque ripple smoothing, and microstepping work together to bring step motor performance to a new high. To complement the drive Applied Motion offers a specially matched set of low-loss NEMA 23 and 34 frame motors (see Related and Recommended Products below), all specifically designed with high voltage operation in mind. Power to the drive comes from single-phase 220 VAC, and the drive can output up to 2.55 A/phase (peak-of-sine) to the step motor. Protection features like over-voltage, over-temperature, and over-current prevent damage while running in adverse conditions.

The STAC5-IP-E220 incorporates EtherNet/IP network communications, the widely used industrial protocol for manufacturing automation applications. With EtherNet/IP users can control, configure and query the drive using an open, standards-based, industrial Ethernet connection at speeds up to 100 MBits/sec. The STAC5-IP drives run all of the same control modes as STAC5-Q drives, with the addition that all drive features can be accessed over EtherNet/IP, including more than 100 commands and 130 registers for controlling motion, I/O, configuration, polling, math, register manipulation, and Q programming.

For connecting to external devices such as limit switches, proximity or photoelectric sensors, PLC I/O, lamps, and other devices, the drive comes with 12 digital inputs, 6 digital outputs, and 1 analog input. In addition to EtherNet/IP the drive supports Ethernet TCP and UDP protocols for sending commands from Applied Motion's proprietary Serial Command Language (SCL). The same 10/100 Mbit Ethernet port on the drive is also used for configuring and programming the drive using the ST Configurator™ and Q Programmer™ software applications, respectively.

The STAC5-IP-E220 comes with an encoder feedback connector for applications that demand a higher level of position control than ordinary open-loop step motor systems can provide. Use our double-shaft step motors with incremental encoders and activate either Stall Detection or Stall Prevention in the drive. Stall Detection notifies the system as soon as the required torque is too great for the motor, which results in a loss of synchronization between the rotor and stator, also known as stalling. Stall Prevention automatically adjusts motor speed to maintain synchronization of the rotor to the stator under all conditions. This unique feature allows step motors to operate in a much broader range of applications than previously possible, such as torque-control. The Stall Prevention feature also performs static position maintenance, which maintains the position of the motor shaft when at rest. Additionally, the inclusion of the optional encoder allows the motor to be precisely homed to the index (marker) pulse.

This step motor drive is UL Recognized (File No. E332730), CE approved, and RoHS compliant.

description:
The STF06 stepper drive is a DC-powered microstepping drive for controlling two-phase, bipolar step motors. It offers advanced current control and an anti-resonance algorithm that electronically damps motor and system resonances to improve motor smoothness and usable torque over a wide speed range. The drive employs electronic torque ripple smoothing and microstep emulation to greatly reduce motor noise and vibration. The drive must be powered from 12 to 48 VDC and can output up to 6.0 A/phase (peak-of-sine) to the step motor. Over-voltage, over-temperature and over-current protection features prevent damage while running in adverse conditions.

Matching Motors

The STF06 is complemented by a specifically matched set of stepper motors (see Related and Recommended products below). For a higher-powered STF drive see the STF10.

For stepper drives with encoder feedback options see the ST Series Stepper Drives.

Inputs and Outputs

For connecting to external devices such as control signals, limit switches, proximity or photoelectric sensors, PLC I/O, lamps, and other devices, the drive comes with 8 digital inputs and 4 digital outputs. The function of each I/O point is configured with the STF Configurator software. Details on wiring different I/O types can be found in the STF Hardware Manual (see Downloads section).

Note: Flying lead I/O cable is sold separately, P/N 3004-348 .

Available Part Numbers:

There are four different communication options to choose from, as shown in the table below. All STF06 drives offer stored program execution using Applied Motion's Q Programming language.

Drive Part No.CommunicationsDescription
STF06-RRS-485
  • Dual RS-485 ports for configuration, programming, and daisy chain networking connections.
  • Stream commands from a host controller to as many as 32 axes using Applied Motion's Serial Command Language (SCL).
  • Built-in support for Modbus RTU communciations.
STF06-CCANopen
  • Dual CANbus ports for daisy chain network and operation as a slave node on CANopen networks.
  • Conforms to Can in Automation (CiA) DS301 and DS402 specifications.
  • Supports Profile Position, Profile Velocity and Homing modes, as well as the ability to run stored Q programs via Applied Motion-specific CANopen objects.
STF06-DEthernet
  • This model has been replaced by the STF06-IP.
STF06-IPEtherNet/IP
  • Dual fast 10/100 Mbit Ethernet ports for configuration, programming and daisy chain networking connections.
  • Designed for use on EtherNet/IP networks, the widely used industrial protocol for manufacturing automation applications.
  • With EtherNet/IP, users can control, configure and query the drive using an open, standards-based, industrial Ethernet connection at speeds up to 100 Mbits/sec.
STF06-ECEtherCAT
  • Specifically designed to operate on EtherCAT networks using the CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol.
  • Conforms to CiA DS402 specifications.
  • Supports Cyclic Synchronous Position(CSP), Profile Position, Profile Velocity and a range of Homing modes.
  • Able to run stored Q programs, which can be controlled over the EtherCAT network via Applied Motion-specific objects.
STF06-ECX EtherCAT
  • Specifically designed to operate on EtherCAT networks using the CANopen over EtherCAT (CoE) protocol and VoE (Vendor Specific Protocol over EtherCAT)
  • Conforms to CiA402 and CiA301 specifications.
  • Supports Cyclic Synchronous Position(CSP), Profile Position, Profile Velocity and a range of Homing modes.
  • Able to run stored Q programs, which can be controlled over the EtherCAT network via Applied Motion-specific objects.
features: Programmable microstepping drive with multiple communication options | Advanced current control for optimal open loop performance | Anti-resonance algorithm maximizes torque over a wide speed range | Torque ripple smoothing increases smoothness and decreases vibrations | Microstepping and Microstep Emulation | Dual port communication for daisy chain network | Wide current range 0.1 to 6.0 A/phase (peak of sine) with idle current reduction | 8 digital inputs, 4 digital outputs (optically isolated)
